title: ICE: tuple_fields called on non-tuple

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
A simple actix web example without `async` keyword for manual_hello function ### Code ```Rust use actix_web::{get, web, App, HttpResponse, HttpServer, Responder}; fn manual_hello() -> impl Responder { HttpResponse::Ok().body("manual Hey there!") } #[actix_web::main] async fn main() -> std::io::Result<()> { HttpServer::new(|| App::new().route("/", web::get().to(manual_hello))) .bind("127.0.0.1:8080")? .run() .await } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.49.0-nightly (043eca7f0 2020-10-17) binary: rustc commit-hash: 043eca7f0b34d12e61c44206beca740628647080 commit-date: 2020-10-17 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.49.0-nightly LLVM version: 11.0 ``` ### Error output ``` error[E0277]: the trait bound `fn() -> impl Responder {manual_hello}: Factory<_, _, _>` is not satisfied --> src/main.rs:9:60 | 9 | HttpServer::new(|| App::new().route("/", web::get().to(manual_hello))) | ^^^^^^^^^^^^ the trait `Factory<_, _, _>` is not implemented for `fn() -> impl Responder {manual_hello}` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/sty.rs:2138:18: tuple_fields called on non-tuple thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:945:9 ```
Backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: std::panicking::begin_panic 1: rustc_errors::HandlerInner::bug 2: rustc_errors::Handler::bug 3: rustc_middle::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt::{{closure}} 4: rustc_middle::ty::context::tls::with_opt::{{closure}} 5: rustc_middle::ty::context::tls::with_opt 6: rustc_middle::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt 7: rustc_middle::util::bug::bug_fmt 8: rustc_trait_selection::traits::select::SelectionContext::evaluate_stack 16: rustc_middle::dep_graph::::with_deps 17: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_anon_task 18:
